text: Just got scammed....price tag indicated $0.90. Picked it up & passed it to cashier. Boom! $1.50.......caveat emptor
For a simple provision shop, it has 5 star service (courteous and caring). Price reasonable too. Shop keeper even suggested non-refigerated drink knowing that i just completed a run. üëç

As a resident of the area, I've been passing by this convenience store for years. It's famous for playing suggestive jazz music, frankly it's a bit strange but okay.

My only gripe about the place is that it requires a minimum of $3 for digital payments. Last time, it was a minimum purchase of $3 to use NETS. I understand that it's a small business, and commissions eat up a lot of the profit margins.

However, why is a minimum purchase of $3 needed for paylah/paynow purchases? The banks take ZERO commissions for these payment methods. I was forced to buy a $2 bag of  potato chips because my initial purchase of $2.50 wasn't enough.

So many small business shops accept Paylah/Paynow direct payment because there is zero commission. Seriously, get on with the times lah. Stop trying to be so greedy.
This may be Singapore‚Äôs best sounding bus interchange convenience store with an awesome sound system and good taste in fusion jazz music. Keeping it classy and friendly. Shiok.

One of the best minimarts around. This minimart is conveniently located at the MRT and Bus station and interchange, and also has a really large variety of food. If you can't find it at 7-eleven, go here. Lovely staff as well! Only thing missing is paywave...
